column4:
Qt installation not detected.
2005-12-22T15:06:00.000Z	nubuntu		Set $QTDIR correctly and reru - What would be right path here? /usr/local/qt3 ?
where is this happening?
installing Exscalibar
since i don't know what it is -- do you actually mean installing, or *compiling*?
compiling I guess :) sorry, but setting path, doesnt help. Same response
is it a KDE program or just a QT program?
try installing libqt3-mt-dev, or kdelibs4-dev
think I got those actually...
well, be very sure you do before going mad trying to compile... "apt-cache policy libqt3-mt-dev" will tell you if it's really installed
off course Im sure. Not going mad, only almost :)
would you give me a link to the archive you're trying to compile so i can try as well?
thanks
try "export QTDIR=/usr/lib/qt3"
thanks!
jackpot! :)
i can confirm it compiles with QTDIR set to /usr/lib/qt3. don't know why it doesn't work "out of the box", that's a very strange configure script they're using
your the master
did you successfully compile that program? At make, I get "/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lsndfile
i get that too, but then i didn't install libsoundfile, i stopped after i saw the QT part worked
so installing libsoundfile then
you need either libsndfile0-dev or libsndfile1-dev, not sure which one yet
libsndfile1-dev is ok
